verses.text: وَٱلطُّورِ
verses.translation: By the mount of Tūr[1],
verses.footnotes: [1] Where Allah Almighty communicated with Moses (عليه السلام).

verses.text: وَكِتَٰبٖ مَّسۡطُورٖ
verses.translation: and by the Book inscribed[2]

verses.text: فِي رَقّٖ مَّنشُورٖ
verses.translation: on an unrolled parchment[3],

verses.text: وَٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ
verses.translation: and by the much-frequented House[4],
verses.footnotes: [4] Which is frequented by angels or the Ka‘bah in Makkah which is frequented by pilgrims.

verses.text: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ
verses.translation: and by the canopy raised high,

verses.text: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ
verses.translation: and by the sea set on fire[5].
verses.footnotes: [5] On the Day of Resurrection, or "by the overflowed sea."

verses.text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
verses.translation: The punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass;

verses.text: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٖ
verses.translation: there is none who can avert it.

verses.text: يَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوۡرٗا
verses.translation: On the Day when the heaven will convulse violently[6],
verses.footnotes: [6] The heavens will be shaken violently, indicating the occurrence of the Hour. The word "maur" originally means turning round, rotating, swinging, swaying, etc.

verses.text: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَيۡرٗا
verses.translation: and the mountains will move a horrible movement[7].
verses.footnotes: [7] They will turn into dust, moving as clouds.

verses.text: فَوَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
verses.translation: Then woe to the deniers on that Day,

verses.text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي خَوۡضٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ
verses.translation: those who amuse themselves in falsehood.

verses.text: يَوۡمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
verses.translation: On the Day when they will be shoved into the Fire forcefully,

verses.text: هَٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.translation: [They will be told,] “This is the Fire which you used to deny.

verses.text: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَآ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
verses.translation: Is this [punishment] magic, or do you not see?

verses.text: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوٓاْ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: Burn in it, whether you bear it patiently or impatiently, it makes no difference to you[8]; you are recompensed only for what you used to do.”
verses.footnotes: [8] He who is patient during afflictions in the life of this world will be rewarded. As for the Hereafter, suffering patiently in Hell will not bring any reward or benefit.

verses.text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَعِيمٖ
verses.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss,

verses.text: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.

verses.text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you used to do,

verses.text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّصۡفُوفَةٖۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ
verses.translation: reclining on couches all lined up”. And We will marry them to houris with wide beautiful eyes.

verses.text: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ وَمَآ أَلَتۡنَٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيۡءٖۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٞ
verses.translation: As for those who believe and their offspring follow them in faith, We will cause their offspring to join them, and will not detract anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Everyone will be accountable for what he earned[9].
verses.footnotes: [9] i.e., None will be held responsible for the burden of another.

verses.text: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٖ وَلَحۡمٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ
verses.translation: And We will provide them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.

verses.text: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا لَّا لَغۡوٞ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمٞ
verses.translation: They will pass around to one another a glass [of pure wine] which does not lead to idle talk or sin.

verses.text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانٞ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ
verses.translation: They will be served by their servant boys, as if they were well-protected pearls.

verses.text: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
verses.translation: They will turn to one another with questions[10].
verses.footnotes: [10] They will probably ask one another about their worldly lives and what led them to Paradise.

verses.text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِيٓ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِينَ
verses.translation: They will say, “Before this, we used to be in awe [of Allah] when we were living among our people.

verses.text: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ
verses.translation: Therefore Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

verses.text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. He is indeed the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”

verses.text: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٖ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ
verses.translation: So keep exhorting [O Prophet], for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

verses.text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٞ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ
verses.translation: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await a misfortune[11]”?

verses.text: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُواْ فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
verses.translation: Say, “Wait, I too am waiting with you.”

verses.text: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
verses.translation: Do their minds[12] prompt them to say such things, or are they transgressing people?
verses.footnotes: [12] The leaders of pagans in Makkah claimed to be of great minds. Here it questions their intelligence, arguing that a man cannot be a madman and a poet at the same time.

verses.text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
verses.translation: Or do they say, “He has made this [Qur’an] up”? Rather, they are not willing to believe.

verses.text: فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِحَدِيثٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: Then let them produce a discourse like this, if they are truthful[13].
verses.footnotes: [13] Arab pagans were challenged to produce the like of this Quran, ten surahs, or one surah, but the challenge has never been met until the present day. See 2:23, 11:13, 52:34.

verses.text: أَمۡ خُلِقُواْ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ شَيۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ
verses.translation: Were they created by none, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

verses.text: أَمۡ خَلَقُواْ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
verses.translation: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Rather, they are not certain in faith.

verses.text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۜيۡطِرُونَ
verses.translation: Or do they possess the treasures of your Lord, or do they have full control [of everything]?

verses.text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمٞ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِيهِۖ فَلۡيَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: Or do they have a stairway [to the heaven] by which they eavesdrop? Then let those who eavesdrop produce a compelling proof.

verses.text: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ
verses.translation: Or does He have daughters while you have sons[14]?

verses.text: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ
verses.translation: Or are you asking them [O Prophet] for a reward so they are overburdened by debt?

verses.text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ
verses.translation: Or do they have [the knowledge of] the unseen so they are writing it down?

verses.text: أَمۡ يُرِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗاۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِيدُونَ
verses.translation: Or do they intend a plot [against the Prophet]? But the plot of the disbelievers will rebound against themselves.

verses.text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَٰهٌ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
verses.translation: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.

verses.text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ كِسۡفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطٗا يَقُولُواْ سَحَابٞ مَّرۡكُومٞ
verses.translation: If they were to see pieces of the sky falling down[15], they would still say, “[This is only] a mass of clouds.”
verses.footnotes: [15] As a sign of the punishment that they requested.

verses.text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يُصۡعَقُونَ
verses.translation: So leave them alone until they encounter their Day in which they will be struck down[16],
verses.footnotes: [16] i.e., they will be punished on the Day of Judgment.

verses.text: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
verses.translation: the Day their plots will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.

verses.text: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ عَذَابٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
verses.translation: And for the wrongdoers, there will be another punishment before that[17], but most of them do not know.
verses.footnotes: [17] In this world such as famine, droughts, or defeat at the battle, or punishment in the grave.

verses.text: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
verses.translation: Be patient [O Prophet] with your Lord’s decree, for indeed you are under Our [Watchful] Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.

verses.text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
verses.translation: And glorify Him at night and when the stars fade away[18].
verses.footnotes: [18] i.e., the early hours of the morning when the stars set; the time of the Fajr Prayer.
